pages.text: Decorated Pots don't actually do anything in this version of Minecraft, but they still make great decorations!
The first step to making a Decorated Pot is to knap some blank sherds from clay.
Once you have your sherds, you can knap patterns into them. Note that this is $(bold)not$() clay knapping; blank sherds are needed as an ingredient.
Four unfired sherds of any pattern can be crafted into an Unfired Decorated Pot.
The pot can then be fired in a $(l:tfc:getting_started/pit_kiln)Pit Kiln$(), and can then be placed. Be careful! Breaking the pot with a tool will shatter it into sherds!

Sherds can also be fired independently. Fired sherds are not particularly useful, but can be used for roleplaying purposes (as an early-game alternative to coins, perhaps). $(br2)All sherds can also be $(l:tfc:bsa/clay_dust)salvaged$() for their clay.
